AMG1L.VS.summary: AB Amber Grid operates as a natural gas transmission system company in the Republic of Lithuania. The company is involved in the transmission of natural gas through high pressure pipelines to system users. It also operates, maintains, and develops natural gas transmission system that includes gas transmission pipelines, gas compressor stations, gas metering and distribution stations, and cathodic protection installations, as well as data transmission and telecommunications systems. The company's natural gas transmission system consists of 2,115 km of gas transmission pipelines, 65 gas distribution stations, 3 gas metering stations, and 2 gas compressor stations. It serves companies operating in the sectors of electricity, district heating, and industry; and medium-sized local businesses, as well as natural gas suppliers receiving natural gas transmission services. The company was founded in 2013 and is based in Vilnius, the Republic of Lithuania. AB Amber Grid is a subsidiary of UAB EPSO-G.

APG1L.VS.summary: APB Apranga, together with its subsidiaries, engages in the retail trade of apparel in the Baltic States. It operates a chain of 186 stores in Lithuania, Latvia, and Estonia. The company was founded in 1945 and is based in Vilnius, Lithuania. APB Apranga is a subsidiary of UAB MG Baltic investment.

AUG1L.VS.summary: Auga Group AB, together with its subsidiaries, operates an organic food production company in Lithuania. It operates through Crop-Growing, Mushroom Growing, Dairy, and End-Consumer Packaged Goods segments. The company is involved in the mushroom growing; organic milk production, and cattle raising and sale activities; and growing of various crops such as organic wheat, legumes, rapeseed, sugar beets, oat, and barley as well as other crops, including grasses and corn for feed. It also offers ready-to-eat soups, preserved mushrooms, packaged vegetables, bottled milk, milk-shakes, eggs, poultry, flour, and other products. The company provides human resource management, trade and logistics, IT system development, machinery leasing, land rental, and agricultural services. The company manages approximately 39,000 hectares of organically certified arable land, as well as uses proprietary and contracted manufacturing to produce a range of organic food products for the end consumer, as well as organic commodities purchasers. It also exports its products to Scandinavian and Baltic countries, Poland, Germany, and France, as well as in the United States, the United Arab Emirates, and Japan. The company was founded in 2003 and is headquartered in Vilnius, Lithuania. Auga Group AB is a subsidiary of Baltic Champs Group, UAB.

GRG1L.VS.summary: Grigeo AB produces and sells toilet papers, paper towels, paper napkins, corrugated cardboards, hardboards, and products from corrugated cardboards in Lithuania. The company operates through three segments: Paper and Paper Products; Wood Fibre Boards and Wood Processing; and Raw Material for Corrugated Cardboard and Related Production. It is also involved in the manufacture of raw materials for the production of corrugated cardboards; honeycomb cardboard paper and filler for use in the furniture, automotive, and construction industries, as well as for the manufacture of doors, wall panels, exhibition stands, and trays; and second-hand paper collection and preparation for recycling. In addition, the company engages in the building construction and real estate development activities. It also exports its products to Poland, Sweden, the United Kingdom, Finland, and internationally. The company was formerly known as Grigeo GrigiÂkes AB and changed its name to Grigeo AB in April 2017. Grigeo AB was founded in 1823 and is based in Vilnius, Lithuania.

IGN1L.VS.summary: AB Ignitis grupe generates, distributes, trades, and supplies electricity and heat. It also produces renewable electricity; supplies liquefied natural gas via terminal; trades and distributes natural gas; and constructs, repairs, maintains electricity networks and related equipment, as well as connects customers to electricity networks. In addition, the company provides information technology, telecommunications, and other services; public procurement, accounting, and legal personnel administration services; and payment collection services, as well as engages in the transportation management activities. Further, it operates wind power plants; and produces metal structures, as well as involved in the rental, leasing, repairing, and maintenance services for vehicles. AB Ignitis grupe was founded in 2008 and is headquartered in Vilnius, Lithuania.

IGV.F.summary: AB Ignitis grupe generates, distributes, trades, and supplies electricity and heat. It also produces renewable electricity; supplies liquefied natural gas via terminal; trades and distributes natural gas; and constructs, repairs, maintains electricity networks and related equipment, as well as connects customers to electricity networks. In addition, the company provides information technology, telecommunications, and other services; public procurement, accounting, and legal personnel administration services; and payment collection services, as well as engages in the transportation management activities. Further, it operates wind power plants; and produces metal structures, as well as involved in the rental, leasing, repairing, and maintenance services for vehicles. AB Ignitis grupe was founded in 2008 and is headquartered in Vilnius, Lithuania.

INC1L.VS.summary: UTIB INVL Technology is a principal investment firm. The firm primarily invests as a cluster of IT businesses with a focus in three areas, such as business climate improvement and e-governance, IT services and software, and cyber security. The firm typically invests in Northern and Eastern Europe, countries of Sub-Saharan Africa and South and Southeast Asia. The company was formerly known as BAIP Grupe AB. UTIB INVL Technology was founded in 2015 and is based in Vilnius, Lithuania.

INL1L.VS.summary: INVL Baltic Farmland, AB, together with its subsidiaries, invests in and leases agricultural land for farmers and agricultural companies in Lithuania. It owns 465 land plots covering the land area of approximately 3,000 hectares. The company is also involved in the financing activity. INVL Baltic Farmland, AB was founded in 2014 and is based in Vilnius, Lithuania.

INR1L.VS.long_name: Special Closed-Ended Type Real Estate Investment Company INVL BALTIC REAL ESTATE
INR1L.VS.summary: Public Joint - Stock Company INVL Baltic Real Estate is a real estate investment firm based in Vilnius, Lithuania. Public Joint - Stock Company INVL Baltic Real Estate operates independently of Invalda LT, AB as of April 29, 2014.

IU8.MU.summary: AB Zemaitijos pienas, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells dairy products in Lithuania and internationally. The company's products include fermented cheese, pre-packaged cheese, processed cheese, cream, cream cheese, butter, dairy spreads, mixed spreads, milk fats, pasteurized cream, buttermilk, whey, and dried milk products. It also offers fresh dairy products, such as milk, cream, curd, yogurts, desserts, curd cheese, and glazed curd cheese. In addition, the company provides transportation and storage services; and engages in the retail trade of dairy products. It offers its products under DÂiugas, Magija, Piknik, Saulute, Germantas, Rambyno, Dobilas, and Âemaitijos brand names. The company was founded in 1924 and is based in TelÂiai, Lithuania.

IVL1L.VS.summary: Invalda INVL, AB is a private equity firm specializing in investments in small and middle-market privately-held companies, acquisitions and buyouts in undervalued assets. The firm primarily invests in real estate, agriculture, agricultural land, furniture manufacturing, information technology, banking, and facilities management infrastructure sectors. It seeks to invest in Lithuania, Latvia, European Union, mainly in Western Europe and internationally. It seeks to exercise control or significant influence over target businesses. The firm prefers to exit its investment when the portfolio company has a liquidity event, such as a sale, recapitalization or listing in the stock exchange. Invalda INVL, AB was formerly known as Invalda LT. Invalda INVL, AB was founded in 1991 and is based in Vilnius, Lithuania.

KNF1L.VS.summary: AB Klaipedos nafta engages in the operation of oil terminal, oil products transshipment, and other related activities primarily in Lithuania. It operates through KNF, SGD, SNT, and GDP segments. The company also operates liquefied natural gas terminals. It transships oil products, including diesel fuel of various types, gasoline of various types, jet fuel, fuel oil of various types, biofuel, vacuum gas oil, and crude oil products; reloads crude oil and oil products into trucks; and accumulates and stores crude oil and oil products. The company also engages in the collection of waste water from sea vessels; mooring; inspection of quality parameters of oil products; blending of heavy and light oil products; and supply of fuel and water to vessels. In addition, it stores and handles oil products; and adds bio-additives and marks substances to oil products. The company was founded in 1994 and is based in Klaipeda, Lithuania.

KNR1L.VS.summary: AB Kauno Energija generates and supplies heat to consumers in the cities of Kaunas and Jurbarkas in Kaunas district. The company also generates and distributes electric energy; and maintains engineering structures, such as collectors and manifolds, as well as heat unit equipment. In addition, it is involved in the supervision of indoor heat and hot water supply systems; repair of heat units and other heating equipment; and provision of rental services premises. The company's total installed heat generation capacity includes approximately 672 MW of heat and approximately 681 MW of electricity. As of 31 December, 2019, it supplied heat to 3,571 businesses and organizations, and 116,444 households. AB Kauno Energija is headquartered in Kaunas, the Republic of Lithuania.

LGD1L.VS.summary: Litgrid AB, together with its subsidiaries, operates electricity transmission systems in Lithuania. It serves electricity transmission grid users and suppliers of balancing and regulating electricity. The company was formerly known as LITGRID turtas AB and changed its name to Litgrid AB in March 2011. The company is based in Vilnius, Lithuania. Litgrid AB is a subsidiary of EPSO-G UAB.

LNA1L.VS.summary: AB Linas Agro Group, through its subsidiaries, engages in the production, handling, and merchandise of agricultural and food products in Lithuania, Scandinavian, rest of Europe, Africa, Asia, and CIS countries. The company operates through five segments: Grain and Feedstuff Handling and Merchandising; Products and Services for Farming; Agricultural Production; Food Products; and Other Products and Services. The Grain and Feedstuff Handling and Merchandising segment trades in wheat, rapeseed, barley, and other grains; oilseeds; suncake and sunmeal; and sugar beet pulp, soymeal, vegetable oils, rapecake, and other feedstuffs, as well as provides grain storage and logistics services. The Products and Services for Farming segment sells fertilizers, seeds, plant protection products, agricultural machinery and equipment, spare parts, and other equipment, as well as offers grain storage facilities to agricultural produce growers and grain storage companies. The Agricultural Production segment cultivates cereals, oilseed rape, sugar beet, and other crops; harvests, breeds, and sells livestock; and produces and sells milk, as well as engages in the beef cattle farming business. The Food Products segment is involved in the egg incubation, chicken hatching, broiler breeding, production of poultry and processed products, and slaughtering and sale of chicken. This segment offers its products under the Kekava and Bauska brand names. The Other Products and Services segment sells biofuels and other products and services. The company also rents and manages agricultural purposes land; and provides expedition and ship's agency, and management services. The company was founded in 1991 and is based in PaneveÂys, Lithuania. AB Linas Agro Group is a subsidiary of Akola ApS.

LNS1L.VS.summary: AB Linas produces and sells linen textile products in Lithuania. It offers garments; bathrobes, towels, and hats; bed sets, sheets, pillow cases, and duvet covers; linen and half linen fabrics, such as cotton, viscose, and elastane; tablecloths, placemats, napkins, and potholders; aprons, mittens, towels, etc.; and curtains, throws, decorative pillows, and chair covers. The company also exports its products to Spain, Sweden, Finland, Japan, Great Britain, Latvia, France, the United States, Denmark, Estonia, Belgium, South Korea, Germany, Australia, and internationally. AB Linas was founded in 1957 and is based in Panevezys, Lithuania.

NTU1L.VS.summary: Novaturas AB engages in the tour operator and travel agency activities in the Baltic States. The company operates through Flight Package Tours, Sightseeing Tours by Plane, Sightseeing Tours by Coach, and Other segments. It offers summer and winter package holidays, as well as sightseeing tours by coach and aircraft to approximately 30 destinations worldwide. The company also sells flight tickets and hotel accommodations. It offers its products through retail travel agencies and internal sales channels, as well as an e-commerce platform. The company was founded in 1999 and is headquartered in Kaunas, Lithuania.

PTR1L.VS.summary: AB Panevezio Statybos Trestas, together with its subsidiaries, designs and constructs buildings, structures, equipment, communications, and other facilities and networks in Lithuania and internationally. It operates through four segments: Construction, Steel Structures, Wooden Panel Houses, and Other Activity. The Construction segment engages in electrical installation works, renovation of buildings, installation of plumbing, sewage and fire protection systems, video surveillance systems, and security and fire alarm systems. The Steel Structures segment involved in designing and fabrication of steel structures for construction purposes, as well as supplies steel structures to various companies. The Wooden Panel Houses segment manufactures, constructs, and outfits wooden panel houses. The Other Activity segment engages in real estate development; wholesale trades of building materials; and production of aluminium constructions, concrete floor, and conditioning systems installation. The company undertakes industrial, public, cultural heritage, and residential projects. It engages in the indoor water supply. The company was founded in 1957 and is based in Panevezys, Lithuania.

PZV1L.VS.summary: Pieno Zvaigzdes, AB, a milk processing company, produces and sells dairy products in Lithuania. The company's products include milk, flavored milk drinks, mozzarella, yogurt, sour cream, butter, cheese, cheese sticks, cottage and cream cheese, cream cheese bars, farmer's cheese, desserts, kefir, processed cheese, and ice-cream; and cagliata cheese, skimmed milk powder, and whey powder. It sells its products to retail stores directly, as well as through distributors. The company also exports its products to Russia and Belarus, as well as to countries of the European Union, CIS, and Asia. Pieno Zvaigzdes, AB is headquartered in Vilnius, Lithuania.

RSU1L.VS.summary: RokiÂkio Suris AB produces and trades in fermented cheese, whey products, and skimmed milk powder in Lithuania. The company operates in two segments, Fresh Dairy Products, and Cheese and Other Dairy products. It also provides fresh milk products, such as milk, kefir products, sour milk, butter, curd, curd cheese, sour cream, glazed curd cheese bars, desserts, and fermented cheeses, as well as purchases raw milk. The company also exports its products to 42 countries worldwide. Rokiskio suris AB was founded in 1925 and is based in Rokiskis, Lithuania.

SAB1L.VS.summary: AB Siauliu Bankas provides commercial banking products and services to private and corporate customers in the Republic of Lithuania. Its banking products and services include various bank accounts; time deposits, accumulative deposits, and savings deposits; consumer credits, credit cards, real estate credit, mortgage loans, credits for farmers, and short-term and long-term credits, as well as multi-apartment house renovation loans; and structural funds, payments, cash operations, and payment cards. The company also provides e-banking, foreign exchange, factoring, and leasing services, as well as other banking services. In addition, it offers investment instruments and transactions, securities trading services, investment funds, life insurance, reports and recommendations to investors, debt securities quotes, pension accumulation funds, and currency risk management services. Further, the company is involved in the management and administration of real estate properties; investment management business; and development of residential multi-apartments. As of December 31, 2019, it had 60 customer service outlets. AB Siauliu Bankas was founded in 1992 and is headquartered in Siauliai, the Republic of Lithuania.

SNG1L.VS.summary: AB Snaige, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells refrigerators and refrigerating equipment under the SNAIGE brand name primarily in Lithuania. The company offers combined refrigerators with separate external doors, single cooler refrigerators, and freezers; commercial refrigerators for businesses, hotels, and restaurants; spare parts for refrigerators, and tools and equipment; refrigerator-showcases; and wine refrigerators. It also exports its products to approximately 30 countries. The company was founded in 1963 and is headquartered in Alytus, Lithuania. AB Snaige is a subsidiary of Sekenora Holdings Limited.

TEL1L.VS.summary: Telia Lietuva, AB provides telecommunications, information technology (IT), and television (TV) services to business and residential customers in the Republic of Lithuania. It offers fixed and mobile telephony, fixed and mobile Internet access, TV, 118 directory inquiry, data communication and network capacity, and customer care services, as well as sells equipment. The company also provides data solutions, including capacity transit, IP transit, leased lines and circuits, L2 Ethernet, international VPN MPLS, peering, and telehousing services. In addition, it offers data center, infrastructure as a service, virtual service infrastructure, SAP hosting, IT outsourcing, storage as a service, backup and recovery, disaster recovery, infrastructure management, and cloud solutions, as well as IT equipment. The company was formerly known as Teo LT, AB and changed its name to Telia Lietuva, AB in February 2017. The company was founded in 1992 and is headquartered in Vilnius, Lithuania. Telia Lietuva, AB is a subsidiary of Telia Company AB.

TREN.summary: Trend Innovations Holding, Inc. intends to operate a Web platform that connects food lovers with culinary craftsmen of their communities. It creates a network between people who cook at home and are willing to sell their meals online and those looking for homemade delicacies. The company was formerly known as FreeCook. Trend Innovations Holding, Inc. was incorporated in 2017 and is based in Vilnius, Lithuania.

UD5.MU.summary: AB Utenos Trikotazas, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells knit-wear and textile articles, and related goods under the UTENOS and ABOUT brand names. It operates through two segments, Production of Knitted Articles and Production of Working Clothes. The company is also involved in sewing clothes; and retail and wholesale trade of knit-wear and textile articles. It operates in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Lithuania, and internationally. The company was founded in 1967 and is based in Utena, Lithuania. AB Utenos Trikotazas is a subsidiary of UAB Koncernas SBA.

UDW.MU.summary: AB Vilkyskiu pienine, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells various types of cheese in Lithuania, rest of the European Union, and internationally. It operates through three segments: Cheese, Cheese Products and Other; Dry Milk Products; and Fresh Milk Products. The company offers fermented, mozzarella, mould, smoked, melt, cottage, and other cheese products; and milk, sour creams, glazed curd bars, butter, kefir, yogurts, dry milk, and whey products. It also leases buildings. AB Vilkyskiu pienine was founded in 1993 and is headquartered in VilkyÂkiai, Lithuania.

UE3.MU.summary: Vilniaus Baldai AB designs, produces, and sells flat-pack furniture in Lithuania and internationally. It is also involved in the packaging activities. The company was founded in 1883 and is based in Vilnius, Lithuania. Vilniaus Baldai AB is a subsidiary of Invalda Privatus Kapitalas AB.

UTR1L.VS.summary: AB Utenos Trikotazas, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells knit-wear and textile articles, and related goods under the UTENOS and ABOUT brand names. It operates through two segments, Production of Knitted Articles and Production of Working Clothes. The company is also involved in sewing clothes; and retail and wholesale trade of knit-wear and textile articles. It operates in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Lithuania, and internationally. The company was founded in 1967 and is based in Utena, Lithuania. AB Utenos Trikotazas is a subsidiary of UAB Koncernas SBA.

VBL1L.VS.summary: Vilniaus Baldai AB designs, produces, and sells flat-pack furniture in Lithuania and internationally. It is also involved in the packaging activities. The company was founded in 1883 and is based in Vilnius, Lithuania. Vilniaus Baldai AB is a subsidiary of Invalda Privatus Kapitalas AB.

VLP1L.VS.summary: AB Vilkyskiu pienine, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells various types of cheese in Lithuania, rest of the European Union, and internationally. It operates through three segments: Cheese, Cheese Products and Other; Dry Milk Products; and Fresh Milk Products. The company offers fermented, mozzarella, mould, smoked, melt, cottage, and other cheese products; and milk, sour creams, glazed curd bars, butter, kefir, yogurts, dry milk, and whey products. It also leases buildings. AB Vilkyskiu pienine was founded in 1993 and is headquartered in VilkyÂkiai, Lithuania.

W9Z.SG.summary: Auga Group AB, together with its subsidiaries, operates an organic food production company in Lithuania. It operates through Crop-Growing, Mushroom Growing, Dairy, and End-Consumer Packaged Goods segments. The company is involved in the mushroom growing; organic milk production, and cattle raising and sale activities; and growing of various crops such as organic wheat, legumes, rapeseed, sugar beets, oat, and barley as well as other crops, including grasses and corn for feed. It also offers ready-to-eat soups, preserved mushrooms, packaged vegetables, bottled milk, milk-shakes, eggs, poultry, flour, and other products. The company provides human resource management, trade and logistics, IT system development, machinery leasing, land rental, and agricultural services. The company manages approximately 39,000 hectares of organically certified arable land, as well as uses proprietary and contracted manufacturing to produce a range of organic food products for the end consumer, as well as organic commodities purchasers. It also exports its products to Scandinavian and Baltic countries, Poland, Germany, and France, as well as in the United States, the United Arab Emirates, and Japan. The company was founded in 2003 and is headquartered in Vilnius, Lithuania. Auga Group AB is a subsidiary of Baltic Champs Group, UAB.

WHX.F.summary: APB Apranga, together with its subsidiaries, engages in the retail trade of apparel in the Baltic States. It operates a chain of 186 stores in Lithuania, Latvia, and Estonia. The company was founded in 1945 and is based in Vilnius, Lithuania. APB Apranga is a subsidiary of UAB MG Baltic investment.

The company operates in two segments, Fresh Dairy Products, and Cheese and Other Dairy products. It also provides fresh milk products, such as milk, kefir products, sour milk, butter, curd, curd cheese, sour cream, glazed curd cheese bars, desserts, and fermented cheeses, as well as purchases raw milk. The company also exports its products to 42 countries worldwide. Rokiskio suris AB was founded in 1925 and is based in Rokiskis, Lithuania.

In addition, the company provides transportation and storage services; and engages in the retail trade of dairy products. It offers its products under DÂiugas, Magija, Piknik, Saulute, Germantas, Rambyno, Dobilas, and Âemaitijos brand names. The company was founded in 1924 and is based in TelÂiai, Lithuania.

ZS4.SG.summary: AB Snaige, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells refrigerators and refrigerating equipment under the SNAIGE brand name primarily in Lithuania. The company offers combined refrigerators with separate external doors, single cooler refrigerators, and freezers; commercial refrigerators for businesses, hotels, and restaurants; spare parts for refrigerators, and tools and equipment; refrigerator-showcases; and wine refrigerators. It also exports its products to approximately 30 countries. The company was founded in 1963 and is headquartered in Alytus, Lithuania. AB Snaige is a subsidiary of Sekenora Holdings Limited.

ZWS.F.summary: Telia Lietuva, AB provides telecommunications, information technology (IT), and television (TV) services to business and residential customers in the Republic of Lithuania. It offers fixed and mobile telephony, fixed and mobile Internet access, TV, 118 directory inquiry, data communication and network capacity, and customer care services, as well as sells equipment. The company also provides data solutions, including capacity transit, IP transit, leased lines and circuits, L2 Ethernet, international VPN MPLS, peering, and telehousing services. In addition, it offers data center, infrastructure as a service, virtual service infrastructure, SAP hosting, IT outsourcing, storage as a service, backup and recovery, disaster recovery, infrastructure management, and cloud solutions, as well as IT equipment. The company was formerly known as Teo LT, AB and changed its name to Telia Lietuva, AB in February 2017. The company was founded in 1992 and is headquartered in Vilnius, Lithuania. Telia Lietuva, AB is a subsidiary of Telia Company AB.
